page.title: 16VISIT TO HIGHWAYS DEPARTMENT
page.content: While we were looking at the heavy traffic on the Queensferry Road, some of our class at Clermiston School paid a visit to the Highways Department of Lothian Regional Council who are res- ponsible for providing and maintaining the city roads. We learned how a traffic survey is done if the Council are considering providing a pedestrian crossing. A common kind is the pelican crossing, where you wait till a green man sign is lit up to show you that the traffic has been signalled to stop and allow you to cross. Other crossings are subways, zebra crossings and footbridges. Special films are taken at intervals and then speeded up to show how and where people cross roads. When the numbers of pedestrians and vehicles using a road are known, a special sum is worked out to see whether a crossing is necessary.
